definition: in a wink
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to blink/to wink
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: She conjured up a whole meal in a jiffy.
sentences.chinese: 一眨眼工夫她就变出了一桌饭菜。

sentences.english: The race started. The hare darted almost out of sight at once.
sentences.chinese: 比赛开始了，一眨眼工夫，兔子已经跑得不见了踪影。

sentences.english: The life like dream, comes in a hurry, the twinkling of an eye several years passed by.
sentences.chinese: 人生如梦，来来匆匆，一眨眼就十几年过去了。

definition: in a wink
in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
(of passing time) in an instant/(of a sight) in a flash
in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
(literary) suddenly
(of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
period of time (may be months, or mere seconds)/spare time/skill/labor/effort
(old) laborer
in a flash/twinkling/ephemeral
one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
split second
in the wink of an eye/in a flash
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
a snap of the fingers (idiom); in an instant/in a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
wordless and uncommunicative (idiom); without speaking/taciturn/not providing any news
